## Installation

You can install the released version of cffr from [CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org) with:

``` r
install.packages("cffr")
```

And the development version from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("dieghernan/cffR")
```
## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r example, eval=FALSE}
library(cffr)
## basic example code
cff_create(".")
```
That produces this output:

```{r echo=FALSE, comment=""}
library(cffr)

# This is for demo purposes only. Show this result instead the previous chunk
demo_file <- system.file("examples/DESCRIPTION_demo", package = "cffr")
cff_create(demo_file)
```
